title: Strictly's Dev and Dianne admit they thought they'd make it to final
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell have admitted that they weren’t expecting to leave Strictly Come Dancing so soon – and thought they were on their way to the finals.

The pair were united in shock this weekend when they became the third couple eliminated from this year’s series, despite consistently high scores.

Speaking on the controversial decision, the pair both admitted they were gutted, but on spin-off show It Takes Two maintained their composure as they spoke about their early exit.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Dev told host Rylan Clark-Neal: ‘Every single week is so different, I don’t think you can ever take your position from the week before for granted. The scores don’t carry over.

‘When I woke up that day I didn’t think I’d be in the bottom two, but you can never tell, can you?’

Admitting that he struggled with his Cha Cha to Dancing With A Stranger by Sam Smith, Dev looked resigned as he told Rylan that it ‘clearly wasn’t enough’ to convince the judges to make them stay.

When asked by Rylan about how she felt when the light turned red, Dianne said she was ‘in a lot of shock’ and confessed: ‘I didn’t think that Dev would be in the bottom two for a while actually, if at all.’

Dev and Dianne admitted they thought they were safe (Picture: BBC)

‘I think he did an amazing job on Saturday night and I thought his dance off was even better,’ Dianne added.

‘I’m so proud of him, and just really upset that we were in the bottom two and we happened to leave the competition,’ she added.

Talking about the moment they heard that they were in the dance-off, Dianne said: ‘I feel like I kind of promised Dev that we were going to be fine, but then we weren’t. But then we sort’ve picked ourselves up and thought we could be safe here if we really go all out.

The couple were clearly devastated as they said goodbye to the show (Picture: BBC)

‘They said the dancing was great, but they wanted him to be a bit more cheeky in the Cha Cha,’ she added on the judges’ comments.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘So I feel like Dev went out there and did exactly what they said.’

Unfortunately for the pair of them, it wasn’t enough and Dianne was left in tears as the judges’ unanimously opted to save Visountess Emma Weymouth and Aljaz Skorjanec instead.

More: Strictly Come Dancing Joe Sugg finds it 'odd' that phone lines suddenly jammed for Strictly's Dianne and Dev Sorry, everyone: Nick Hewer has turned down both Strictly and I'm A Celebrity Strictly head judge Shirley Ballas addresses Dev Griffin elimination controversy

On top of viewers threatening to boycott the show in light of the shocking early exit for ‘Team Red Devils’, others claimed that they couldn’t get through on the phone line to vote for them.

Others slammed the judges for their ‘seriously odd’ scores throughout the Saturday live show, which also affected the couples’ safety.

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One and BBC iPlayer.

description: Dev and Dianne became the third couple eliminated from the competition on Strictly Come Dancing - despite being firm favourites.
